issue.title: Errors on running rsa3072_dilithium2's hybrid algo
issue.body:
My intention is to run rsa3072_dilithium2's hybrid algorithm and see the result of the hybrid certificate and understand how it works.

However, I faced some difficulties.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65388283/126450984-3f19b08c-02bb-4953-8fcb-e5b339c9faa0.png)

(1) I want to ask if this is the intended result of the certificate?
(2) What is the implication of `unable to upload public key`?
(3) Since it is a hybrid certificate, why can't I see both the RSA and the Dilithium's signature, and instead I am seeing a single long signature?
(4) For the signature Algorithm's identifier, is there a table to translate the identifiers to their corresponding signature names and their corresponding name?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65388283/126452411-21a71b4b-b83f-4b71-ae47-df0adf205c62.png)

Thanks in advance !

comment.body:
@baentsch Yep it does answer my question. Thank you so much for replying me, really appreciate it.

Just an additional question, I am wondering how the signing of the certificate works for hybrid algorithm.

My guess is that the certificate will be signed with a traditional algorithm and PQ algorithm in parallel. The signature obtained will then be appended together to form a final signature.

Is there any way for me to confirm my guess? Thanks in advance!

issue.title: Errors on running rsa3072_dilithium2's hybrid algo
issue.body:
My intention is to run rsa3072_dilithium2's hybrid algorithm and see the result of the hybrid certificate and understand how it works.

However, I faced some difficulties.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65388283/126450984-3f19b08c-02bb-4953-8fcb-e5b339c9faa0.png)

(1) I want to ask if this is the intended result of the certificate?
(2) What is the implication of `unable to upload public key`?
(3) Since it is a hybrid certificate, why can't I see both the RSA and the Dilithium's signature, and instead I am seeing a single long signature?
(4) For the signature Algorithm's identifier, is there a table to translate the identifiers to their corresponding signature names and their corresponding name?

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/65388283/126452411-21a71b4b-b83f-4b71-ae47-df0adf205c62.png)

Thanks in advance !

comment.body:
> Is there any way for me to confirm my guess? Thanks in advance!

Yes, you can read [this comment](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/blob/fb4d9e3ab7d8376dc15606301e0793d574b1251c/crypto/ec/oqs_meth.c#L13-L24) and the code below implementing it.

issue.title: Sync with PQClean
issue.body:
<!-- Please give a brief explanation of the purpose of this pull request. -->
Sync with PQClean https://github.com/PQClean/PQClean/commit/6c1ea921ee4a06a6b50c742ca540bb9b5e51aee2. 

Related to #1058.

comment.body:
It would be nice to trigger the documentation update in `copy_from_upstream.py`. 

My thought was to first extend `update_pqclean_alg_docs.py` to also support non-PQClean algorithms (such as using the META.yml at https://github.com/pq-crystals/dilithium), and subsequently fold this script into `copy_from_upstream.py`.

issue.title: Update KEM and Signature information table once liboqs YAML docsheets are available.
issue.body: Add "NIST Round" and "Specification Version" fields to https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/blob/OQS-OpenSSL_1_1_1-stable/oqs-template/generate-oid-nid-table.py once https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/issues/892 is addressed.

comment.body: Would it also be worthwhile to add a "Specification Version" field?

issue.title: Update KEM and Signature information table once liboqs YAML docsheets are available.
issue.body: Add "NIST Round" and "Specification Version" fields to https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/blob/OQS-OpenSSL_1_1_1-stable/oqs-template/generate-oid-nid-table.py once https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/issues/892 is addressed.

comment.body:
> Would it also be worthwhile to add a "Specification Version" field

Thought about it but didn't see enough of a difference to the current "Implementation Version" field.

issue.title: use doc YMLs to count non-copy-from-upstream algs [skip ci]
issue.body:
Fixes #1040 

* [ ] Does this PR change the input/output behaviour of a cryptographic algorithm (i.e., does it change known answer test values)?  (If so, a version bump will be required from *x.y.z* to *x.(y+1).0*.)
* [ ] Does this PR change the the list of algorithms available -- either adding, removing, or renaming?  (If so, PRs in OQS-OpenSSL, OQS-BoringSSL, and OQS-OpenSSH will also be required by the time this is merged.)

comment.body: I'll assume that you ran the updated copy\_from\_upstream script and it yielded the same output as the previous version.

issue.title: automate setting security/NIST levels in generate.py using liboqs input
issue.body:
Fixes #315 

This new logic could also be used to completely do away with fields "[bits_]security" in `generate.yml` (as it can deduce them from `liboqs`' `claimed_nist_level`. What'd you think @dstebila @xvzcf ?

comment.body:
> @dstebila Rebased the PR so you can investigate as per last week's meeting. Looking over the changes, I'm baffled that we apparently still have code points like "p256_kyber90s1024: 1263" (not present any more if this PR is merged).

I'm not able to run what's here successfully.  When I run `python3 oqs-template/generate.py`, it results in code that has basically removed all hybrids (e.g., https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/openssl/blob/1ef99fbe2c7f0f15f755e0618c541d80c1b70fc7/oqs-interop-test/common.py#L19 is empty). So I'm not confused about how to proceed since it's not in the state I expected...

issue.title: Examples fail to run with some JDKs on macOS
issue.body:
I am trying to integrate `liboqs` into a Java project by using `liboqs-java`.
The OS is macOS Big Sur (11.4) and the JDK is Amazon Corretto 8, installed by `brew install --cask corretto8`.

When I try to run the signature example, I got the following error:
```
~/Code/open-quantum-safe/liboqs-java master  javac -cp target/liboqs-java.jar examples/SigExample.java                                  12:13:20
~/Code/open-quantum-safe/liboqs-java master  java -cp target/liboqs-java.jar:examples/ SigExample                                       12:13:24
Supported signatures:
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /private/var/folders/jm/886yj20s08bcrb560kxvfbwm0000gn/T/oqs-native-lib5047501627777998882/liboqs-jni.jnilib: dlopen(/private/var/folders/jm/886yj20s08bcrb560kxvfbwm0000gn/T/oqs-native-lib5047501627777998882/liboqs-jni.jnilib, 1): Library not loaded: @rpath/liboqs.0.dylib
  Referenced from: /private/var/folders/jm/886yj20s08bcrb560kxvfbwm0000gn/T/oqs-native-lib5047501627777998882/liboqs-jni.jnilib
  Reason: image not found
	at java.lang.ClassLoader$NativeLibrary.load(Native Method)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary0(ClassLoader.java:1934)
	at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1817)
	at java.lang.Runtime.load0(Runtime.java:810)
	at java.lang.System.load(System.java:1088)
	at org.openquantumsafe.Common.loadNativeLibrary(Common.java:53)
	at org.openquantumsafe.Sigs.<clinit>(Sigs.java:12)
	at SigExample.main(SigExample.java:9)
```

The same error occurred for the key encapsulation example as well.

I've already tried the suggestion in [the troubleshooting section](https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs-java#troubleshooting), but it doesn't help.
I also tried switching from Amazon Corretto to Azul Zulu Java 8, but it didn't help either.
What works for me is to change the JDK to `openjdk@8` (installed by `brew install openjdk@8`), with which both `SigExample` and `KEMExample` can run.

However, the problem for me is that `openjdk@8` is actually not the recommended JDK for the project I'm working with due to its own limitations, so I'd prefer to stick with Amazon Corretto.

How can I successfully run the examples with Amazon Corretto then?

comment.body:
Did you check that the file really exists while running the test with Amazon Coretto?  
I had some problems with write and read permissions while trying on android.  
As you can see the interesting part is where the library gets extracted and loaded:   
  
at org.openquantumsafe.Common.loadNativeLibrary(Common.java:53)  
  
Probably you could work around the problem by installing the liboqs.jar
